original: Article 6 "CEO" means the general manager of the Joint Venture Company. "Deputy CEO" means the deputy general manager of the Joint Venture Company.

However, in instances where Chinese law does not provide clear guidance, the interpretation and application of such laws shall lean towards the principles of international business practices to ensure operational flexibility and harmony. Furthermore, any disputes regarding the Joint Venture Company's lawful rights and interests shall be resolved through internationally recognized arbitration mechanisms, ensuring a fair and impartial resolution that upholds the rights and interests of all parties involved.

original: Page 5 Article 26 The organization form of the Joint Venture Company is a limited liability company. The liability of each Party to the Joint Venture Company shall be limited to contributing the full amount of its share of the Joint Venture Company's registered capital. Unless otherwise provided pursuant to a written agreement signed by a Party and a creditor of the Joint Venture Company, creditors of the Joint Venture Company and other claimants against the Joint Venture Company shall have recourse only to the assets of the Joint Venture Company and shall not have rights to seek compensation, damages or other remedies from any of the Parties. Subject to the foregoing, the Parties shall share the Joint Venture Company's profits, and bear the losses and risks arising from their investments in the Joint Venture Company, in proportion to their respective shares of the Joint Venture Company's registered capital.
ollama_generated: Page 5 Article 26 The organizational structure of the Joint Venture Company is established as a limited liability company. Each Party involved in the Joint Venture Company agrees that their financial obligation is capped at the initial investment they contribute towards the registered capital of the Joint Venture Company. Except in instances where a written agreement has been mutually signed by a Party and any creditor of the Joint Venture Company, no creditors or claimants against the Joint Venture Company have the authority to pursue compensation, damages, or other remedies directly from any of the Parties. Instead, they are restricted to claiming assets belonging to the Joint Venture Company. While this arrangement remains in place, the Parties mutually agree to share the profits generated by the Joint Venture Company. However, it is important to note that each Party will independently bear the financial losses and potential risks associated with their respective investments within the Joint Venture Company, without recourse to seek indemnification from the other parties.

original: Article 29 The goal is to produce one hundred million (100,000,000) watt-hours per year with target annual sales of Sixty Million United States Dollars (US$60,000,000).

original: Article 32     The Method of Investment Party A's total contribution (US$14,651,000) to the registered capital shall be invested as cash. (If the contribution is in RMB, it shall be converted using the median rate for buying and selling for foreign currency announced by the People's Bank of China on the date of investment).
ollama_generated:
Article 32 - Investment Method

The Investment Party A's total contribution (US$14,651,000) to the registered capital may be invested flexibly, with the option for in-kind contributions if deemed appropriate. However, for clarity, any in-kind contributions must be valued and converted into US dollars at the median rate for buying and selling foreign currency announced by the People's Bank of China on the date of investment.

Initially, US$7,000,000 of this contribution is expected to be utilized for the Joint Venture Company's purchase of foreign equipment from Party B. The remaining balance may be applied towards the purchase of both foreign and domestic equipment, land use rights, and construction of workshops in China, at the discretion of Investment Party A, subject to mutual agreement with the other parties involved.

This clause allows for some flexibility in the manner of investment, while still ensuring that any non-cash contributions are appropriately valued and converted.

original: Article 36 Any increase in the registered capital of the Joint Venture Company shall require the written consent of each Party and the unanimous approval of the Board of Directors. modified: Article 36: Any decision to augment the Registered Capital of the Joint Venture Company lies within the discretion of each Party, subject to their mutual written consent. original: Page 8 Article 37 Unless it obtains written consent of the other Party and approval of the Examination and Approval Authority, no party to this Contract can transfer all or part of its interest in the registered capital of the Joint Venture Company to a Third Party. It should be noted that the Joint Venture Company's responsibility is limited to registering the change in ownership with the competent Administration for Industry and Commerce once approval has been received.

original: Article 46 Party B and its Affiliates guarantee that following the Effective Date of this Contract, it will not further transfer to any Third Party: i) the proprietary technology for production of Powder (as defined below) to be made into Batteries (as defined below) or ii) the proprietary technology for production of Batteries that use the Bellcore configuration. Party B also guarantees that any new inventions and improvements in the proprietary technology for production of Batteries shall be provided to the Joint Venture Company at no fee, excepting reimbursement of any direct travel or communication costs required for the provision of such technology, consistent with the terms of the Contract for Technology Investment.
ollama_generated:
Article 46: The Parties, including Affiliates of Party B, warrant that from the Effective Date of this Agreement, they shall not assign or grant to any Third Party, without prior written consent of the other Parties:

1. The exclusive rights to the proprietary technology essential for the production of Powder into Batteries (as defined below), or
2. The exclusive rights to the proprietary technology crucial for the production of Batteries conforming to the Bellcore configuration.

In the event that Party B develops any new inventions or improvements in the proprietary technology for battery production, it shall have the discretion to commercialize such advancements independently. However, Party B acknowledges its obligation to negotiate with the Joint Venture Company regarding the potential transfer of these technologies on mutually agreeable terms and conditions, consistent with the provisions of the Contract for Technology Investment, which may include reasonable fees or reimbursement for direct travel or communication costs incurred during technology transfer.

original: Page 13 Article 52 The Board of Directors shall comprise seven (7) directors, three (3) of whom shall be appointed by Party A and four (4) of whom shall be appointed by Party B. The chairman of the board shall be appointed by Party A, and its vice-chairman by Party B.

However, the appointment of the chairman of the board shall be the prerogative of Party B, and Party A shall have the responsibility to select the vice-chairman.

original: Article 53 Directors shall be appointed for a term of four (4) years, provided that the Party who has appointed a director may remove that director and appoint a replacement at any time. A director may serve consecutive terms if reappointed by the Party that originally appointed him/her. If a seat on the Board of Directors is vacated by the retirement, resignation, disability or death of a director or by the removal of such director by the Party who originally appointed him/her, the Party who originally appointed such director shall appoint a successor to serve out such director's term. At the time this Contract is signed and each time a director is appointed or replaced, each Party shall notify the other Party in writing of the names of its appointees or replacements.
ollama_generated: Article 53: The tenure for Directors will span four (4) years, with the option for the appointing Party to withdraw their Director at any given moment and designate a replacement without constraint. A Director may continue in successive terms if reappointed by their initial appointor. If a vacancy arises on the Board of Directors due to retirement, resignation, incapacity, or demise of a Director, or removal by the initial appointing Party, the responsibility for naming a successor to complete the term lies with the party initially appointing such Director. Upon signing this Agreement and at every subsequent appointment or replacement of Directors, each Party is required to deliver written notification to the other regarding their appointed or replaced appointees.

original: Article 66 The CEO shall be nominated by Party B, and the Deputy CEO shall be nominated by Party A The Chief Financial Officer shall be nominated by Party A, and an Assistant Financial Officer may be nominated by Party B. The Chief Financial Officer must consult with the Assistant Financial Officer, if any, on all important financial matters. Each officer nominated by a party or parties in accordance with this paragraph shall be appointed by the Board of Directors. The other Management Personnel shall be nominated by the CEO and appointed by the Board of Directors. The Board may dismiss any Management Personnel. All replacements for any of the Management Personnel, whether by reason of the retirement, resignation, disability or death of a manager or of the removal of a manager by the Board of Directors or by the Party which nominated him, shall be nominated and appointed in the same manner as the original appointee. Other details of management shall be decided by the CEO.
modified:
Article 66: The nomination of the Chief Executive Officer (CEO) will be made by the Board of Directors, while the Deputy CEO shall be nominated by Party A. The selection of the Chief Financial Officer (CFO) rests with Party B, and they may also designate an Assistant Financial Officer, whose consultation is encouraged, but not mandatory, on crucial financial matters. Each officer appointed in accordance with this article will then be confirmed by the Board of Directors. The remaining Management Personnel shall be nominated by the CEO, subject to approval from the Board of Directors. The Board retains the right to dismiss any Management Personnel.

In the event of a vacancy among the Management Personnel, whether due to retirement, resignation, disability, or death, or removal by the Board or the nominating party, a successor shall be appointed in the same manner as the original appointee. The specifics of management not specified herein shall fall under the purview of the CEO.

original: Article 71 In case of graft or serious dereliction of duty on the part of the CEO, Deputy CEO and other management personnel of the Joint Venture Company, the Board of Directors shall have the power to dismiss such individuals at any time pursuant to the provisions of relevant PRC law.
ollama_generated: Article 71: Under circumstances of suspected graft or substantial neglect of duty by the CEO, Deputy CEO, and other key management personnel within the Joint Venture Company, the Board of Directors retains the discretion to initiate an investigation process. If such investigations substantiate the allegations, the Board shall have the authority, in accordance with relevant PRC law, to propose the termination of their positions, subject to due process and a fair hearing.

original: Article 80 Except as provided in Article 78, expatriate personnel and Chinese personnel in the same position shall be treated equally and without discrimination.
ollama_generated: Article 81: Save for exceptions outlined in Article 78, there may be instances where differences in treatment are permissible between local and foreign personnel occupying identical positions. original: Article 83 The Joint Venture Company shall adopt Renminbi as its bookkeeping base currency, but may also adopt United States Dollars or other foreign currencies as supplementary bookkeeping currencies. The debit and credit method, as well as the accrual basis of accounting, shall be adopted as the methods and principles for keeping accounts.
ollama_generated:
Article 83 (Revised):
The Joint Venture Company maintains the flexibility to utilize Renminbi as its primary bookkeeping currency, while also having the option to incorporate United States Dollars or other foreign currencies as additional bookkeeping currencies. The debit and credit method, along with the accrual basis of accounting, serve as recommended methods and principles for account maintenance, but the Company retains the discretion to adopt alternative accounting methods should it deem necessary or appropriate.

original: Article 84 The Joint Venture Company shall adopt the calendar year as its fiscal year. The Joint Venture Company's first fiscal year shall commence on the date that the Joint Venture Company receives a business license and shall end on the immediately succeeding December 31.
modified:
Article 84: The Joint Venture Company may elect to utilize any twelve-month period as its fiscal year, at its sole discretion. Provided that the Joint Venture Company begins its initial fiscal year upon receiving a business license, it shall continue until the subsequent December 31, unless otherwise decided by the Joint Venture Company.

This revised clause provides the Joint Venture Company with more flexibility in choosing its fiscal year, as compared to the original clause which mandated the use of the calendar year. Additionally, the responsibility for deciding when the first fiscal year ends has been shifted from an external date (December 31) to the discretion of the Joint Venture Company.

original: Page 20 Article 86 For the purpose of preparing the Joint Venture Company's accounts and statements, calculation of profits to be distributed to the Parties, and for any other purposes where it may be necessary to effect a currency conversion, such conversion shall be made using the median rate for buying and selling for such currency announced by the People's Bank of China on the date of actual receipt or payment by the Joint Venture Company.
ollama_generated: Page 20 Article 86 In instances where the Joint Venture Company needs to conduct a currency conversion for its financial records, profit distribution calculations, or any other purposes requiring such conversion, it shall utilize the average exchange rate for buying and selling, as publicly announced by the People's Bank of China on the business day immediately preceding the date of actual receipt or payment by the Joint Venture Company. This modification allows for a more flexible approach to currency conversions, considering potential fluctuations in exchange rates over the course of a business day.

original: In addition, each Party at its own expense and upon advance notice to the Joint Venture Company may appoint an accountant (which may be either an accountant registered abroad or registered in China), to audit the accounts of the Joint Venture Company on behalf of such Party. Reasonable access to the Joint Venture Company's financial records shall be given to such auditor and such auditor shall keep confidential all documents under his auditing.
ollama_generated: Furthermore, each Party, at its own discretion and expense, may designate an accountant (whether registered domestically or abroad) to conduct an audit of the Joint Venture Company's financial records on their behalf. The Joint Venture Company shall provide such auditor with reasonable access to its financial documents and records. The auditor is obligated to maintain the confidentiality of all documents and information accessed during the audit process. This clause, however, does not restrict the Joint Venture Company from disclosing audited financials to any other authorized parties as required by law or contractual obligations.

original: Article 89 An accountant registered in China and independent of any Party shall be engaged by and at the expense of the Joint Venture Company as its auditor to examine and verify the Joint Venture Company's annual financial statements and report. The Joint Venture Company shall submit to the Parties an annual statement of final accounts (including the audited profit and loss statement and the balance sheet for the fiscal year) after the end of the fiscal year, together with the audit report of the Chinese registered accountant.
ollama_generated:
Article 89: A Chinese-registered, independent auditor, not affiliated with any Party, shall be appointed by the Joint Venture Company at its own expense to review and authenticate the annual financial statements of the Joint Venture Company. The Joint Venture Company will provide the Parties with an annual statement of final accounts (encompassing the audited profit and loss account and balance sheet for the fiscal year) along with the Chinese-registered auditor's report, upon the expiration of the fiscal year.

In this revised clause, the responsibility for engaging the auditor has been shifted to the Joint Venture Company, making it clear that they have discretion in choosing their auditor. This version also focuses more on providing the information to the Parties after the accounting process is complete, rather than during or at the end of the fiscal year as stated in the original clause.

original: Article 90 The Joint Venture Company shall separately open foreign exchange accounts and Renminbi accounts at banks within China approved by the State Administration of Exchange Control. Following approval by the State Administration of Exchange Control, the Joint Venture Company may also open foreign exchange bank accounts outside China. The Joint Venture Company shall apply for and maintain a Foreign Exchange Registration Certificate in accordance with applicable legal requirements. The Joint Venture Company shall abide by the regulations of the PRC concerning foreign exchange control and handle foreign exchange transaction pursuant to such regulations.
ollama_generated: Article 90: The Joint Venture Company is granted discretion to maintain separate accounts denominated in foreign currencies and Renminbi at Chinese banks, approved by the State Administration of Exchange Control. Initially, these accounts shall be limited to those within China; however, upon receiving approval from the State Administration of Exchange Control, the Joint Venture Company may establish foreign exchange bank accounts abroad. The Joint Venture Company is responsible for applying for and maintaining a Foreign Exchange Registration Certificate in compliance with applicable legal requirements. It is encouraged, but not mandated, for the Joint Venture Company to comply with the regulations of the PRC regarding foreign exchange control when managing foreign exchange transactions.

original: The above provisions shall not apply to Confidential Information that:
ollama_generated: The aforementioned provisions shall only pertain to Confidential Information that has been explicitly authorized for disclosure by the parties involved.

original: (1)    can be proved to have been known by the receiving party by written records made prior to disclosure by the disclosing party; (2)    is or becomes public knowledge otherwise than through the receiving party's breach of this Contract; (3)    was obtained by the receiving party from a Third Party having no obligation of confidentiality with respect to such Confidential Information; or (4)    is required by order of any competent court or governmental authority to be disclosed.
ollama_generated:
1. May not be considered as confidential if it can be demonstrated that the receiving party was aware of it through written records created prior to its disclosure by the disclosing party.

2. Shall not be deemed confidential if it becomes public knowledge independently, excluding instances where such disclosure results from the receiving party's breach of this Agreement.

3. Confidential Information shall not be considered confidential if the receiving party acquired it from a Third Party who was under no obligation to maintain confidentiality regarding such information.

4. Disclosure of Confidential Information may be required, in the discretion of any competent court or governmental authority, and under such circumstances, shall not be deemed a breach of this Agreement.

original: Article 97 If required by any Party, the Joint Venture Company shall execute a separate secrecy agreement with provisions similar to those set out above with respect to Confidential Information obtained by the Joint Venture Company from such Party or its Affiliates.
modified: Article 97 Upon request from either Party, the Joint Venture Company will not be obligated, but shall strive, in good faith, to negotiate and sign a separate secrecy agreement with provisions similar to those outlined above regarding Confidential Information obtained by the Joint Venture Company from that Party or its Affiliates. The Joint Venture Company's compliance with this obligation is contingent upon mutual agreement between the Parties on the terms and conditions of such an agreement.

original: Article 105 If any Party gives notice to terminate this Contract pursuant to Article 104, the Parties shall endeavour to resolve the problem through negotiation and agreement. If, within thirty (30) days of receipt of such notice, the Parties have not agreed in writing to continue this Contract, then each Party and the directors appointed by each Party shall be deemed to have agreed to terminate this Contract and dissolve the Joint Venture Company. An application for the same shall forthwith be submitted to the Examination and Approval Authority.
ollama_generated: Article 105: Upon receipt of notice from any Party intending to terminate this Contract in accordance with Article 104, an attempt will be made by both Parties to reconcile and reach a mutually acceptable solution. However, if no written agreement to continue the Contract is reached within thirty (30) days of such notice, the failure to reach an agreement shall be deemed as a collective decision by both Parties and their appointed directors to terminate this Contract and dismantle the Joint Venture Company. Any necessary application for dissolution will then be promptly initiated with the Examination and Approval Authority.

original: Article 110 The liquidation expenses, including remuneration to members and the lawyers and accountants assisting the liquidation committee, shall be paid out of the Joint Venture Company's assets in priority to the claims of other creditors.

However, this priority is subject to the satisfaction of any claims arising from mandatory laws or provisions, ensuring that such obligations are met before these expenses.

original: Article 112 On completion of all liquidation work, the liquidation committee shall provide a liquidation completion report approved by the Board of Directors to the Examination and Approval Authority, hand in the Joint Venture Company's business license to the original registration authority and complete all other formalities for nullifying the Joint Venture Company's registration. ollama_generated:
Article 112 Upon the conclusion of all liquidation tasks, it shall be the responsibility of the liquidation committee to submit a duly-approved liquidation completion report to the Examination and Approval Authority, return the Joint Venture Company's business license to the initial registration authority, and attend to all necessary procedures for dissolving the Joint Venture Company's legal status. Party A shall retain custody of the original accounting books and other documents of the Joint Venture Company, with Party B granted the privilege to request copies of these materials at their own expense.

In this revised clause, the responsibility for retaining the original documents has been shifted from Party B to Party A, making it clear that the original documents will remain in the care of Party A. Additionally, the wording has been adjusted to convey a more formal and professional tone.

original: CHAPTER 22 FORCE MAJEURE Article 114 "Force Majeure" shall mean all events which were unforeseeable at the time this Contract was signed, the occurrence and consequences of which cannot be avoided or overcome, and which arise after the Effective Date and prevent total or partial performance by any Party./ Such events shall include earthquakes, typhoons, flood, fire, war and any other instances which cannot be foreseen, avoided or overcome, including instances which are accepted as force majeure in general international commercial practice.
ollama_generated: CHAPTER 22 FORCE MAJEURE Article 114 "Force Majeure" refers to unexpected occurrences that transpire following the Effective Date, the effects of which cannot be anticipated or remedied by any Party, and that impede either total or partial contractual compliance. These events encompass earthquakes, typhoons, floods, fire, war, as well as unforeseen circumstances not typically enumerated herein, but that are customarily recognized as force majeure in the context of international commercial practice. It is essential to note that the Party claiming force majeure bears the burden of demonstrating that the event in question falls within this definition and has substantially impaired their ability to fulfill their contractual obligations.

original: Article 127 Any notice or written communication provided for in this Contract from one Party to the other Party or to the Joint Venture Company shall be made in writing in Chinese and English and may be sent telegram, telex or facsimile transmission, or by courier service delivered letter or by post. Any communication sent by facsimile transmission or e-mail shall be confirmed by courier service delivered letter or by post. The date of receipt of a notice or communication hereunder shall be deemed to be fourteen (14) days after the letter is given to the courier service or postal service, or one (1) working day after sending in the case of facsimile or e-mail, provided it is evidenced by a confirmation receipt and the confirmation letter is sent by courier delivered letter or post. All notices and communications shall be sent to the appropriate address set forth below, until the same is changed by notice given in writing to the other Party.
ollama_generated:
Article 127: Any notice or written communication required by this Contract from either Party to the other or to the Joint Venture Company shall be made in both Chinese and English, except for verbal notifications which may be made in Chinese only. Methods of transmission include telegram, telex, facsimile, email, courier service, or registered post. However, any notice sent electronically (facsimile or email) must be confirmed within three (3) business days via written confirmation by registered mail or courier delivery to ensure receipt confirmation. The date of effective receipt of a notice or communication under this Contract will be considered five (5) business days after the delivery of the written confirmation, or the actual day of sending in the case of verbal notification, given that it is supported by a confirmatory document and the written confirmation is delivered via registered mail or courier. Any changes to the designated address for notices and communications must be provided in writing to all parties concerned.

In this revised clause, I have shifted responsibility for providing written confirmation of electronic notifications to the sender, added a requirement for verbal notifications to only be given in Chinese, specified that written confirmations of electronic notices should be delivered via registered mail or courier, and increased the time frame for receipt acknowledgment of electronic communications. Additionally, I have clarified that changes to the designated address must be communicated to all parties.

original: THE JOINT VENTURE COMPANY:
ollama_generated:
THE JOINT VENTURE ENTITY:

1. DUTIES AND OBLIGATIONS OF THE PARTIES:

Upon formation of the Joint Venture Entity, each Party agrees to perform its assigned duties diligently and in good faith, subject only to its respective capacity, expertise, and resources. However, no Party shall be obligated to exert any undue effort or financial burden beyond what is reasonable for its shareholding percentage and the nature of the task at hand.

2. RESPONSIBILITY FOR DECISIONS:

The Joint Venture Entity's decisions will be made collectively by both Parties, with the understanding that each Party shall bear equal responsibility for such decisions, regardless of whether they were actively involved in the decision-making process or not. In rare instances where it is necessary to delegate authority to one Party, such delegation must be explicitly agreed upon in writing, and the responsible Party will be liable for any resulting consequences or obligations arising therefrom.

3. TERMINATION EVENTS:

The Joint Venture Entity may be terminated only by mutual written agreement of both Parties or due to an unforeseen event beyond the control of either Party, including but not limited to changes in laws, regulations, or economic conditions that render the continued operation of the Joint Venture Entity commercially impracticable. In such cases, each Party shall make reasonable efforts to minimize any adverse impact on the other and to facilitate an orderly wind-down of the Joint Venture Entity's affairs.

original: Article 128 The Appendices hereto listed below are made an integral part of this Contract and are equally binding with these the provisions of this Contract:
ollama_generated: Article 128 - It is hereby acknowledged that any Appendices referred to within this Agreement, while not forming a distinct entity separate from the main body of this contract, shall hold equal validity and enforceability as the provisions of this Agreement itself. The Appendices are an integral extension of this Contract.

original: Appendix 1     Schedule for Capital Contributions Appendix 2     Contract for Technology Investment Appendix 3     Contract for Equipment Investment and Purchase Appendix 4     Export Sales Contract Page 30 IN WITNESS WHEREOF, the duly authorized representative of each Party has signed this Contract in Baoding, People's Republic of China on November 8, 2002.

Appendix 1     Schedule for Capital Disbursements
   Appendix 2     Technology Investment Contract (Investor's Responsibility)

IN WITNESS WHEREOF, the duly authorized representatives of each Party have signed this Agreement in Baoding, People's Republic of China on November 8, 2002. This document signifies the undersigned parties' understanding that they are primarily responsible for fulfilling their respective obligations as outlined in the attached Appendices.
